intro: Mikania grazielae, commonly known as the Graceful Mikania, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, trailing stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences, typical of the genus Mikania. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native environment.
